newsitem.title: CHINA: China bars 200 ships carrying foreign rubbish.
newsitem.headline: China bars 200 ships carrying foreign rubbish.

text.p: China has this year turned back from its ports more than 200 ships carrying foreign rubbish, waste or dangerous materials, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.

"Since the 1970s some developed countries have shipped large amounts of dangerous goods and rubbish into developing countries, turning the developing countries into their dumping grounds," Xinhua said.
Strict action to ban imports of foreign garbage had effectively curbed the trade in China, the official agency quoted an environmental agency spokesman as saying.

Illegal imports of rubbish from the United States earlier this year spiralled into an issue of national pride, with Chinese officials furiously condemning U.S. shipments of waste paper mixed with old clothes, rubber gloves and diapers.
In June, police in Shanghai arrested one U.S. businessman for alleged involvement in the illegal garbage trade, while border officials tightened procedures to keep out hidden waste.

Among the 200 foreign ships refused permission to enter China was one vessel ship carrying 200 tonnes of garbage that officials forced to return to the United States in August, Xinhua said but gave no details.
China would make it a long-term policy to ban imports of foreign rubbish, it said.
